attributes.comment:
We recently found out that a proposal has been made to increase the fingerprinting
fees and cost of I171H approval.
I just have to say that as an adoptive-to be-parent, I find this proposal to be yet another
reason it seems the governments tries to prohibit orphan adoption. The costs are
daunting, the paperwork excrutiating, add that to the lengthening times of referrals-a
devastation only those waiting can possibly understand.
The last thing we need-after already completing a homestudy, receiving approval , and
refinancing our homes to pay for an adoption,is to have to redo everything and now to
top it off, pay even more money. I do not think it is fair- to increase or even double
charge families that have already been approved.
I was told that this redoing of fingerprints is "for the benefit of the orphan" and I
strongly disagree. People can give birth with no approval whatsoever, they can be
horrid parents, but we as a group have had every aspect of our lives checked out and
have been approved! Anyone undertaking this huge, life altering, decision to adopt an
orphan, in my opinion, has proven themselves fit just by going through the process.
Again, I think increasing fees on those who already have approval is unjust.

Thank you for listening,
Marnie Gray
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Marnie Gray
